config.settings.cmds.cmdHelpEmbed.info.t:
Gives you info on a the {{commandName2}} command's settings.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[view]]`
Whitelist or blacklist certain roles or users from using the {{commandName2}} command. Also toggles between whitelist or blacklist modes.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[[whitelist|blacklist] [add|remove|enable|disable|view]]] <user|role>`
config.settings.cmds.cmdHelpEmbed.setCoo:
Sets a cooldown for using the {{commandName2}} command.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[cooldown [set|view]]] <time in seconds>`
config.settings.cmds.cmdHelpEmbed.title: {{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}}
config.settings.cmds.cmdHelpEmbed.toggle:
Turns the {{commandName2}} command on or off.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[[on|off]]]`
config.settings.cmds.cooldown.currentCoo: The {{commandName}} command's cooldown is set to **{{cooldown}} seconds**.
config.settings.cmds.cooldown.error:
I don't understand, try following this template:

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} [[cooldown [set|view]]] <amount of seconds>`
config.settings.cmds.cooldown.error.alre: The **{{commandName}}** command's cooldown is already **{{newCooldown}}** seconds.
config.settings.cmds.cooldown.error.noCo: You need a number to set the cooldown to.
config.settings.cmds.error.noCommand: **{{commandName}}** is not a command name. Use `{{prefix}}[[commands]]` for a list of commands.
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.footer: You can get a list of commands using {{prefix}}[[commands]].
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.info.text:
Gives you info on a specific command's settings.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] <command> [[view]]`
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.lists.tex:
Whitelist or blacklist certain roles or users from using a command. Also toggles between whitelist or blacklist modes.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] <command> [[[whitelist|blacklist] [add|remove|enable|disable|view]]] <user|role>`
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.setCooldo:
Sets a cooldown for using a specific command.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] <command> [[cooldown [set|view]]] <time in seconds>`
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.title: {{prefix}}[[settings commands]]{{commandName}}
config.settings.cmds.helpEmbed.toggleCom:
Turns a specific command on or off.

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] <command> [[[on|off]]]`
config.settings.cmds.list.error:
I don't understand, try following this template:

`{{prefix}}[[settings commands]] {{commandName}} {{listName}} [[[add|remove|enable|list]]] <username|role>`
config.settings.cmds.list.error.noListIt: **{{listItem}}** is not a role, user, or channel.
config.settings.cmds.list.listEmbed.blac: There are no blacklisted roles, users, or channels.
config.settings.cmds.list.listEmbed.whit: There are no whitelisted roles, users, or channels.
config.settings.cmds.whitelist.error.alr: **{{listItem}}** is already added to the whitelist.
**{{listItem}}** is already removed to the whitelist.
The {{commandName}} command is already set to follow the whitelist.
The {{commandName}} command's  whitelist is already disabled.

info.commands.embed.title: {{clientUsername}} Commands
info.guide.commands.desc:
**Turn commands on/off:**

 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}settings commands <command> [on|off]`]] to toggle the command.
 â€¢ Replace "<command>" with the name of the command, excluding the prefix.
 â€¢ Replace "[on|off]", with *on* or *off*.

**Change command cooldowns:**

 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}settings commands <command> cooldown set <time>`]] to set a cooldown for the command.
 â€¢ Replace "<time>" with how long (in seconds) you would like the cooldown to last.
 â€¢ You can view the command's current cooldown by using `{{prefix}}settings commands <command> cooldown view`.

**Whitelist or blacklist commands:**

 â€¢ Use `{{prefix}}settings commands <command> [whitelist|blacklist] [on|off]` to turn the whitelist/blacklist on or off.
 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}settings commands <command> [whitelist|blacklist] [add|remove] <user|role>`]] to add or remove a user or role to the whitelist/blacklist.
 â€¢ A whitelist only allows the people on the list to use the command.
 â€¢ A blacklist stops only the people on the list from using the command.
 â€¢ Disabling both will allow anyone to use the command.

**View command settings:**

 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}settings commands <command> view`]] to see command info like the state, whitelist, and blacklist.

info.guide.embed.title: {{clientUsername}} Guide
info.guide.info.desc: Tells you an in-depth guide on how to use {{clientUsername}}.
info.guide.options.desc:
â€¢ User options only affect the user's experience, not the entire server's.

**Enabling and disabling options:**

 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}options <option name> [on|off]`]] to turn an option on or off.
 â€¢ Replace "<option name>" with the name of the option, a list can be found using [[`{{prefix}}options list`]].
 â€¢ Replace "[on|off]", with *on* or *off*, depending on which you would like.

**View options:**

 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}options view`]] to view your enabled options.
info.guide.options.title: Changing Your User Options
info.guide.play.desc:
**Reading Embeds:**

 â€¢ Open the uno-channel with your username after you have started a game (using [[`{{prefix}}startgame`]]).
 â€¢ The pinned message will show some basic commands to play, the options you have enabled, and the game settings that are enabled.
 â€¢ A message will be sent, telling you the current player and the current card.

**Playing a Card:**

 â€¢ Use the [[`{{prefix}}play`]] command to play your card. (Use [[`{{prefix}}play help`]] for more command info.)
 â€¢ The play command  requires a color and a number/type of card.
 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}cards`]] for the names of your cards.
 â€¢ Your command should look something like this: `{{prefix}}play red 5`.
 â€¢ If you are playing a wild card, make sure to add the color you want. [[`{{prefix}}play blue wild`]]

**Drawing a Card:**

 â€¢ If you don't have a card to play, use [[`{{prefix}}draw`]] to draw a card from the deck.
 â€¢ After drawing your turn will be over, unless the game setting [[DrawUntilMatch]] is on.
info.guide.play.title: Playing Cards Guide
info.guide.settings.desc:
**Changing the prefix:**

 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}settings prefix <new prefix>`]] to change the prefix.
 â€¢ Replace "<new prefix>" with your new prefix.

**Add or remove default game settings:**

 â€¢ Default game settings (DGS) are game settings that will be applied to every game with no game settings automatically.
 â€¢ Changing DGS require you to vote, which may take a few minutes to update.
 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}settings dgs <game setting> [on|off|view]` ]]to turn DGS on or off.
 â€¢ Replace "<game setting>" with a game setting from [[`{{prefix}}gamesettings list`]].
 â€¢ Replace "[on|off]" with *on* or *off*, depending on if you want to turn the DGS on or off.

**Reset {{clientUsername}}:**

 â€¢ Use [[`{{prefix}}settings reset`]] to reset {{clientUsername}}.
 â€¢ This will reset all of the data {{clientUsername}} has on your server.
 â€¢ When prompted, respond only with "CONFIRM" in all caps to confirm the reset.
info.guide.settings.title: Changing the Server's Settings Guide
info.guide.start.desc:
**Creating a game:**

 â€¢ Start a game using [[`{{prefix}}startgame`]]. (Use [[`{{prefix}}startgame help`]] for more command info.)
 â€¢ Add game settings by typing a list of game settings separated by spaces. (A list of game settings can be found with `{{prefix}}gamesettings list`.)
 â€¢ Your command might look like this: [[`{{prefix}}startgame StackCards, DisableJoin`]].
 â€¢ A startgame message will be sent which allows you to join, start, and end the game using the reactions, :hand_splayed:, :arrow_forward:, and :x: respectively.
 â€¢ After 30 seconds or a force start, your game will start.

**Navigating to your channel:**

 â€¢ A category named 'uno-category' will be created after your game begins.
 â€¢ A text channel will be created in this category for each player you mentioned.
 â€¢ The channel is where the player will play their cards.
